title: Version 0.0.4
muted test not for windows and added windows temp file convention
body:
Fixed the first failure in https://github.com/uutils/coreutils/issues/1747 is due to the truncate command not existing in powershell.

Also changed the default 'mktemp' template to the windows filename convention of XXXXXXX.tmp.

title: factor, stdbuf, timeout, uname, uptime: update dependencies
body:
I have begun to update our dependencies,  The most important update is probably `factor`, since there was a security issue in versions of `smallvec` before 0.6.14 (although I'm not sure it actually affects our code).

You can merge this now (in which case I'll submit more PRs like this) or just wait a few days for me to update everything.

title: numfmt: align format output values with GNU
body:
When converting to SI or IEC, produce values that align with the conventions
used by GNU numfmt.

- values > 10 are represented without a decimal place, so 10000 becomes 10K
  instead of 10.0K

- when truncating, take the ceiling of the value, so 100001 becomes 101K

- values < 10 are truncated to the highest tenth, so 1001 becomes 1.1K

closes #1726

title: uucore: process: fix exit status processing
body: This should resolve #1742.  I've basically switched from using `libc` to Rust's standard library, which dramatically simplifies the code and makes it more portable at the expense of potentially waiting longer for a program to exit before returning its exit status.

title: od: remove Vec::set_len() usage in InputDecoder

labels.name: security
labels.description: Pull requests that address a security vulnerability

body:
This removes the last usage of `Vec::set_len()` with undefined behavior (AFAIK).  Zero-initializing the `Vec` isn't much of an issue here as it is only created once (over the course of the entire program) and the actual amount of allocated memory should be rather small (usually at least).

See #1729 for more info on the undefined behavior.

title: shred: remove usage of Vec::set_len()

labels.name: security
labels.description: Pull requests that address a security vulnerability

body:
This PR removes usage of `Vec::set_len()` (#1729).  It also avoids allocating a new `Vec` every time `BytesGenerator` iterates, so it is most likely actually faster than before.  Note that there is still quite a bit of room for improvement in terms of performance ~(_e.g._ copying entire patterns rather than pushing them to the `Vec` one byte at a time)~ and readability.

There is at least one more instance of `Vec::set_len()` that needs to be fixed (it's in `od` again).  We may want to simply review our usage of `unsafe` in general, as I imagine some of the cruft that's built up over the years can be removed.

title: uucore: fix potential use-after-free in utmpx iterator

labels.name: security
labels.description: Pull requests that address a security vulnerability

body: From what I can tell (the man page is not very useful here), `utmpxname()` uses `strdup()` to copy the string, so it's fine that it is freed afterwards.

title: Do not allow seq to run with an increment of zero
body: I'm not sure about the test included here, as if it fails the test will hang forever.

title: od: remove potential unsoundness and an allocation in PartialReader

labels.name: security
labels.description: Pull requests that address a security vulnerability

body: This should fix the issue for the specific case of unsoundness mentioned in #1729.  Note that there are still uses of `Vec::set_len()` elsewhere (including another in `od`), but I am not planning to remove them until I get an answer to my question in that issue, as removing `Vec::set_len()` in those places will require somewhat more intense refactoring (unless we decide to eat the hit of pointlessly initializing the `Vec`s combined with allocation).

title: yes: correct a typo
body:
Improve readability by fixing an inadvertent rename during a performance
enhancement (b46e228).

title: numfmt: prohibit --header=0 to align with GNU
body:
Adjust header option handling to prohibit passing a value of 0 to align
with GNU numfmt. Also report header option parse errors as GNU does.

closes #1708

title: Fix macOS aarch64 compile errors
body: Fixing macOS aarch64 compile errors. df was bringing in an x86 symbol and libc had to be bumped so 'cp' would link properly.

title: UTF-8 unexpected behavior
body: Documenting unexpected behavior handling UTF-8.  Not only are the counts not the same as GNU 'wc', the pipe in fixture is returning all zero.

title: GNU testsuite: Remove tests checking for --version & --help
body: Not really interesting for us and logs are too big

title: numfmt: handle leading whitespace & implied padding
body:
Align with GNU numfmt by trimming leading whitespace from supplied values.
If the user did not specify a padding, calculate an implied padding from
the leading whitespace and the value.

Also track closer to GNU numfmt’s error message format.

title: Fix the min rust version
Extract the result of the GNU testsuite executions as a warning
numfmt: replace getopts with clap
body:
Hi! This small contribution converts argument parsing in the numfmt utility from getopts to clap.

The test suite passes and clippy and rustfmt are happy.

Please let me know if I can improve this PR.

Thanks!

title: fix(mktemp) - Make mktemp --tempdir foo.XXXXXX works
body: Used by apt-key https://sources.debian.org/src/apt/2.1.20/cmdline/apt-key.in/?hl=76#L76

title: Fix some clippy warnings
Fixed wc -L no end of line LF bug
body: uu_wc -L (count the number of characters in a line) is a GNU extension. I fixed the failing test case from the GNU test suite where the last line of the file does not end in a LF.

title: Fix gnu tests
body:
Ok, I am now confident that the tests are running against the rust code, new results:
```
 # TOTAL: 613
# PASS:  139
# SKIP:  87
# XFAIL: 0
# FAIL:  348
# XPASS: 0
# ERROR: 39
```
Also the running time is now at ~45 minutes.
It would be good if someone could review the results to make sure they are reasonable.

`--filter` argument for `split`
body:
Be able to pass the bytes and filename to a child shell process.
- start a shell process with the provided command-as-a-string
- forward filename (xaa, xab, xac... ) as $FILE env var
- send bytes to each shell process

title: fix(cp) - make "cp /dev/null target" work
ls: only print colors if stdout is a tty
body:
Previously if no --color argument was input, we would always print
colors in the output. This breaks `configure` scripts which run `ls`
and then compare the output against what they expect to see, since the
left side has ANSI escape sequences and the right side doesn't.

Instead, only print escape sequences if a TTY is present, or if
`--color=always` is specified.

Fixes #1638.

title: Fix: install /dev/null target
